{"step_by_step_thinking": "Facial nerve injury during forceps delivery in labor can occur due to compression or trauma to the facial nerve. The forceps can compress the facial nerve as it emerges from the stylomastoid foramen, causing facial paralysis. The beak of the forceps can engage the main trunk of the facial nerve, leading to injury. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Mastoid process being absent at birth (choice A) and parotid gland in developing stage (choice B) are not directly related to facial nerve injury during forceps delivery. Sublingual hematoma (choice D) is not mentioned as a cause of facial nerve injury in the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "C"}
